stories.text:
Went to set up my new car payment...stymied because I could only find 3 of the 4 things I needed. (one, single, hardcopy had the account number in full)

Went to cancel Paramount+...instructions online didn't match the steps needed to do so. (Hit star on your roku and unsubscribe...but it only worked on one of our Rokus)

Went to add information to my insurance claim only to find they'd closed it and the location to add info was well hidden. (All communications are on the claim associated with the vehicle...until they submit the first check, then it dives 8 layers deep, in the closed claims dungeon)

Streaming service? That one's intentional Bank? Probably intentional to cut down on fraud

Insurance? Probably intentional to cut total audience interaction by X%

Man does the internet seem to suck, the closer I look at it.
stories.title: Ask HN: Death of a thousand (dark pattern) cuts

How should it be taught?
stories.title: Ask HN: How would you prefer programming be taught standing in 2022?

stories.text:
Posted this as a comment but wanted to start a separate topic about this:

What if, just what if, everyone in Texas and other backward places starts ddos-ing government by searching for and visiting abortion clinics? Houston, Dallas, Austin n San Antonio have a population of ~6M. Even if 1% of them do a search and visits once per week, that is 60k cases to investigate. Per week.

Is that a legit way to protest governments infringing on our civil rights using surveillance tech?
stories.title: Ask HN: Is this a legit way to protest Texas govt?
